block.p: RADIO ONE INC., Lanham, Md., the largest United States broadcaster serving black audiences, said it had completed its acquisition of 12 radio stations from Clear Channel Communications Inc., San Antonio, and AMFM Inc., Dallas, for about $1.3 billion. Including the acquisitions, Radio One owns 51 stations.

RADIO ONE INC., Lanham, Md., the largest United States broadcaster serving black audiences, said it had completed its acquisition of 12 radio stations from Clear Channel Communications Inc., San Antonio, and AMFM Inc., Dallas, for about $1.3 billion. Including the acquisitions, Radio One owns 51 stations.

JOHNSON CONTROLS INC., Milwaukee, Wis., the second-largest maker of automotive seats and interiors in the world, agreed to jointly develop fiber-based products for automotive interiors with Polymer Group Inc., North Charleston, S.C., a maker of fabrics used in diapers and surgical gauze, increasing the range of items Johnson Controls sells to automakers. Financial terms were not disclosed.

KAYDON CORP., Ann Arbor, Mich., a maker of bearings, filtration products and seals, said it had bought three closely held companies, Tridan International Inc., Indiana Precision Inc. and Canfield Technologies for about $48 million in cash.

UNITED TAPE CO., Cummings, Ga., will be acquired by Intertape Polymer Group Inc., a Canadian maker of plastic packaging. Exact terms were not disclosed. Intertape of Montreal will pay $4 million of stock and an unspecified amount of cash. It will also assume an unspecified amount of debt.
